comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The image seems to be the iconic picture of Nietzsche, used on the cover of more than one biography and found widely on the web in both left-right orientations. Some of those images are definitely photographic. My guess is that John Philipp made this drawing from a photograph. www.artnet.com/artists/lotdetailpage.aspx?lot_id=7359AB6A... shows an etching by John Philipp of Albert Einstein. Signature seems to be similar. ArtNet describes him as John Philipp (German, 1872-1938) This picture of Nietzsche was used opp page 264 of The German Classics of the Nineteenth and Twentieth Centuries (Vol XV) : A. Schopenhauer, R. Wagner, F. Nietzsche, Emperor William II by Kuno Francke, William Guild Howard, Isidore Singer, published in 1914. The image notes that it is with permission of Berlin Photo Co., New York. See books.google.com/books?id=mivZAAAAMAAJ&pg=PR15&lp...
